title: Gonzalo Higuain forced off with head injury after being PUNCHED in the face by Lecce goalkeeper
text:
Gonzalo Higuain was forced off the pitch during Juventus' 1-1 draw with Lecce on Saturday after being punched in the face by the opposition goalkeeper.

Higuain contested a ball into the box with Lecce's goalkeeper Gabriel but was left with blood pouring from his forehead after a collision with the Brazilian.

Gabriel appeared to connect with Higuain's face with his fist and elbow, which left the striker needing a bandage to mop up his bloodied head.

Gonazalo Higuain was accidentally punched in the face by Lecce goalkeeper Gabriel

The blow left Higuain in a daze on the floor with blood gushing from a cut on his forehead

Higuain played on until the end of the game as Juventus drew 1-1 with Lecce in Serie A

Incredibly, Higuain dusted himself down and saw out the rest of the game, which saw Juve drop points for just the second time in Serie A this season.

However, the Argentina international later needed a stretcher to leave the pitch at full-time, leading to questions about his suitability to play on after the incident.

The 31-year-old appeared to have suffered a delayed reaction to the blow though he wasn't knocked out by the goalkeeper's flailing arm.

Juventus confirmed after the game that Higuain had been taken to hospital for further tests on his head injury.

The result means the Bianconeri could see Inter Milan leapfrog them at the top of Serie A if they beat Parma in their clash on Saturday evening.
description: Gonzalo Higuain was forced off the pitch with a bloodied head during Juventus' 1-1 draw with Lecce on Saturday after being punched in the face by the opposition goalkeeper.
